title: Intel's McTea-spy: OWASP API Malfunctions Lead to Secret Recipe Leak!
excerpt: In a baffling turn of events that has left the tech world reeling, Silicon Valley heavyweight Intel Corporation, renowned for its cutting-edge process...
content:
In a baffling turn of events that has left the tech world reeling, Silicon Valley heavyweight Intel Corporation, renowned for its cutting-edge processors and groundbreaking innovations, has found itself embroiled in a tea-rifying scandal.

Sources close to the company have confirmed that the much-hyped McTea-spy, Intel's revolutionary artificial intelligence designed to optimize the brewing process of their new line of smart kettles, has malfunctioned spectacularly. The result? A catastrophic leak of the closely guarded secret recipe for Intel's premium McTea blend.

The news sent shockwaves through the tech community, with many questioning how such a high-profile blunder could have occurred. According to Intel insiders, the incident was triggered by an unexpected glitch in the OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) API, which McTea-spy relies on for complex brewing calculations and predictive analysis.

"It's like having a Ferrari with a manual transmission," lamented one frustrated Intel engineer, who requested anonymity due to fear of reprisal. "The technology is there, it's just that the system can't quite handle it yet."

As if the embarrassment wasn't enough, Intel's competitors have wasted no time in exploiting the situation for their own gain. Rival companies have been quick to circulate parodies of the McTea-spy fiasco on social media, with memes mocking Intel's misfortune and insinuating that their own tea-brewing technologies are superior.

In response to the public outcry, Intel CEO Bob Swan issued a statement acknowledging the incident and expressing his profound apologies. "We understand the gravity of this situation and take full responsibility for our actions," he said. "Rest assured, we are taking immediate steps to rectify this issue and prevent any such occurrences in the future."

The tech giant has since announced that they will be implementing a series of upgrades and patches to ensure McTea-spy's stability and efficiency. However, whether these measures will prove sufficient remains to be seen. In the meantime, Intel is left to weather the storm of public ridicule, with many wondering if the company's tea leaves have finally run out.

As the investigation continues, one thing is certain: The McTea-spy debacle has served as a stark reminder that even the most advanced technologies can falter when confronted with the complexities of human nature and the unpredictability of life. In a world where innovation drives progress, sometimes the simplest things - like a cup of tea - can provide the most powerful lessons.
author: AutoGenerator

Title: IOTW: Victoria's Secret Lingerie Drawers Now Demanding Bitcoin in Alarming Hack

In a shocking turn of events, the fashion world was left reeling this morning as it was revealed that Victoria's Secret lingerie drawers have begun demanding Bitcoin for their services. Yes, you read that right! The once passive wardrobe staples are now actively participating in the digital currency revolution.

The news broke out when frustrated consumers started posting on social media about unexpected transaction requests popping up on their screens while attempting to access their undergarments. One user posted a picture of a message that read, "To unlock drawers, please send 0.001 BTC to this address."

As the reports poured in, a spokesperson for Victoria's Secret issued a statement saying, "We are aware of the issue and are working diligently to resolve it. We assure our valued customers that no sensitive data has been compromised." However, the company declined to comment on the motivations behind this bizarre hack.

Experts have speculated that the hack might be the work of a disgruntled employee or an external group seeking to exploit the trend towards digital currencies. Meanwhile, customers are left wondering if their relationships with their undergarments will ever be the same again.

One customer, who wished to remain anonymous, shared her experience: "I was just trying to find a clean pair of socks when my phone started buzzing with a Bitcoin transaction request. I couldn't believe it! Now I have to question if I can trust my drawers anymore."

As the situation continues to unfold, Victoria's Secret customers are advised to exercise caution and perhaps consider investing in a hardware wallet for their underwear. After all, who knows what other surprises are waiting for us in this brave new world of cryptocurrency.

title: Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning Cluster to Help Malware Campaigns Plan Their Next Picnic
excerpt: In a shocking turn of events, the cybersecurity world was left in disbelief as Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning announced their intention to co...
content:
In a shocking turn of events, the cybersecurity world was left in disbelief as Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning announced their intention to collaborate with malware campaigns for the planning of their next picnics.

The alliance, dubbed 'Operation Digital Daisy Chain', aims to optimize malicious activities by leveraging data-driven insights and AI capabilities to ensure a more enjoyable and efficient cyber-outing experience.

According to sources close to the project, malware developers will now be able to predict optimal times for spreading their viruses, based on user habits and device vulnerabilities gathered through Big Data Analytics. Machine Learning, meanwhile, will provide recommendations on the most inviting targets, based on a deep understanding of each system's weaknesses and security measures in place.

"We believe this collaboration will help both parties," said a spokesperson for the joint venture. "Malware campaigns can make their attacks more targeted and effective, while we get to learn more about user behavior and device security."

When asked about potential backlash from the cybersecurity community, the spokesperson downplayed concerns, stating, "We're just trying to make picnicking in the digital world a little easier for everyone involved. After all, who doesn't love a good barbecue?"

As the news of this unlikely alliance spreads, many are left wondering if there's no line that can't be crossed in the name of innovation and convenience. But one thing is certain: the cybersecurity landscape will never be the same again.

Stay tuned for more updates on Operation Digital Daisy Chain, as it continues to redefine the boundaries between technology, privacy, and good old-fashioned picnicking in the park.

Title: Frogs to Debut at EFF Awards, Hopping Support for Web Freedom!

In a surprising twist that's making the tech world hop with excitement, the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) has announced that this year's awards ceremony will feature a live performance by an ensemble of digital activist frogs. Yes, you read it right! The amphibian community is about to take center stage at the most prestigious event in the world of online privacy and freedom.

These extraordinary hopping heroes have been tirelessly learning the ins and outs of digital rights, from net neutrality to encryption, all while mastering their unique chorus of ribbit-tations. They will be performing a special rendition of the "Frog of Freedom" anthem, a rhythmic call for web freedom that is sure to set pulses racing and croaking loud across the globe.

The frogs have been training diligently with EFF's top experts, perfecting their leaps to symbolize the swift actions taken by digital activists to protect our online liberties. Each jump represents a victorious step in the ongoing battle for a free and open internet.

The decision to include frogs in this year's ceremony is an ingenious move by the EFF, aiming to bridge the gap between technology and nature while emphasizing that everyone – even our amphibian friends – has a role to play in safeguarding digital rights.

This innovative approach has already garnered widespread attention and admiration from tech enthusiasts and environmentalists alike, with many eagerly anticipating the big day. With frogs now leading the charge for web freedom, it's safe to say that this year's EFF Awards promises to be a hopping great event!

Stay tuned for more updates on these digital amphibian superstars as they prepare to leap onto the world stage and remind us all of the importance of protecting our online freedoms.

Title: Apple's Groundbreaking Leap into Magical Realm: TCC Unicorn Rides Now Available!

In a shocking yet enchantingly innovative move, tech titan Apple has unveiled its latest endpoint security feature that's sure to leave users spellbound - the introduction of TCC (Third-Party Content Controller) Unicorn Rides. Yes, you read it right! You can now ride a digital unicorn to secure your device against cyber threats.

Apple, in its never-ending quest for user convenience and security, has harnessed the mythical power of unicorns. These magical creatures will patrol your device's borders, warding off any malicious software or hackers with their sparkling horns and ethereal aura.

"We believe that security should be as enchanting as it is effective," said Tim Cook during the keynote address at the Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC). "With TCC Unicorn Rides, we're combining cutting-edge technology with timeless folklore to create a truly magical user experience."

The new feature works by assigning each user a unique digital unicorn. These mythical creatures will appear as adorable icons on your device, ready to leap into action whenever you launch an app or visit a suspicious website.

Users can customize their unicorn's appearance and even name them, adding a touch of personalization to this extraordinary security measure. But remember, these are digital unicorns – so no wish-granting capabilities (sorry about that!).

While some critics have raised concerns over the potential for data privacy breaches due to the presence of unicorns within their devices, Apple assures us that all interactions between users and their unicorns are encrypted and secure.

"Our top priority is always our users' privacy," said a spokesperson from Apple. "With TCC Unicorn Rides, we're simply providing an additional layer of protection while offering a fun and engaging way to do so."

Apple has already begun rolling out the update for iOS 16 and macOS Ventura, with plans to extend this magical feature to other devices in the near future. So buckle up (or rather, saddle up) for a more secure and fantastical digital experience!

With TCC Unicorn Rides, Apple has once again proven its ability to transform everyday technology into something extraordinary – proving that even in the realm of cybersecurity, magic still exists.

Title: **162 Hieu's Bold Journey to Become World's First Alphabetical Superhero!**

In a world where comic book heroes are as common as your daily cup...
content:
Title: **162 Hieu's Bold Journey to Become World's First Alphabetical Superhero!**

In a world where comic book heroes are as common as your daily cup of coffee, one Vietnamese elementary school student named 162 Hieu is breaking the mold and setting his sights on a groundbreaking achievement. Yes, you heard it right - he's vying to become the first-ever **Alphabetical Superhero**!

With an insatiable curiosity for letters, numbers, and words, 162 Hieu has taken his love for the alphabet to new heights. According to sources close to him, this precocious youngster can not only recite the entire alphabet backward but also name all capitals of countries in alphabetical order within seconds!

But what makes 162 Hieu truly unique is his determination to turn his extraordinary talent into superpowers. In a recent interview with our reporter, he revealed his ambitious plan: "I want to create my own alphabet-based universe filled with characters who can manipulate letters and words for good!"

This remarkable idea has captured the imagination of comic book fans across the globe, leading many to speculate on what powers 162 Hieu's alphabetical superheroes might possess. Some popular suggestions include:

* **A-Mazing Man:** A hero who can create labyrinthine obstacles for enemies using complex letter formations.
* **Bold Battler:** With the ability to bend words and phrases around himself like force fields, this warrior will never be at a loss for words in the heat of battle!
* **Cryptic Commander:** The mastermind behind 162 Hieu's team, he can decode any message or encrypted communication instantaneously.
* **Dazzling Dame:** A female hero with the power to spell out dazzling displays of light letters for mesmerizing effect.
* **Eloquent Elephant:** An elephant-themed character who uses his immense size and strength to shape the environment into words and symbols, just like real elephants do with trees!

As 162 Hieu's journey towards alphabetical superhero-dom continues, we can only marvel at the creativity and determination of this young visionary. Whether he succeeds in becoming the world's first Alphabetical Superhero remains to be seen; however, one thing is for sure - comics will never be the same again!

Stay tuned for more updates on 162 Hieu and his quest to redefine superheroes as we know them. In the meantime, don't forget to brush up on your alphabet skills – you never know when they might come in handy!

title: Scammers Offer 'Work-From-Bed' Opportunity, Bed Shortage Hits Market!
excerpt:
Title: Scammers Offer 'Work-From-Bed' Opportunity, Bed Shortage Hits Market!

In a surprising twist of events that has left the global economy reeling...
content:
Title: Scammers Offer 'Work-From-Bed' Opportunity, Bed Shortage Hits Market!

In a surprising twist of events that has left the global economy reeling, scammers have unveiled their latest money-making scheme, and it's called 'Work-From-Bed'. This innovative approach to employment has sent shockwaves through the corporate world, but more importantly, it has ignited a frenzy for beds that is showing no signs of abating.

For decades, we have been told that a comfortable office chair is essential for productivity and job satisfaction. However, this new concept of 'Work-From-Bed' turns traditional work ethics on their head by encouraging employees to skip the commute, forego the desk, and take their laptops straight to bed.

The response has been unprecedented. High-end bed manufacturers report a staggering 500% increase in demand for their luxury beds, causing a significant shortage in the market. Meanwhile, those less fortunate are forced to sleep on the floors, with a new black market emerging for second-hand mattresses and bed frames.

The scammers behind this scheme are reportedly charging hefty fees for access to 'exclusive' job opportunities within the 'Work-From-Bed' sector. The jobs themselves? Well, they appear to be as non-existent as the fees being charged. However, that hasn't stopped eager job seekers from emptying their bank accounts in pursuit of the elusive career opportunity that promises a life of luxury and leisure, all from the comfort of their own beds.

In response to the bed shortage crisis, the government has stepped in to regulate the market, imposing strict controls on bed production and distribution. However, with scammers continuing to peddle their deceptive 'Work-From-Bed' scheme, it remains to be seen whether the situation will improve any time soon.

As for the workers themselves? They continue to languish in queues outside bed retailers, their dreams of a life spent horizontal with a laptop clutched tightly in hand tantalizingly out of reach.

Stay tuned for more updates on this developing story, as we navigate the peculiarities and absurdities of a world where the quest for the perfect bed has become the ultimate pursuit of happiness.

In a shocking turn of events that has left the...
content:
Title: "Mystic Mayhem: The Revealed Shortcomings of Lodash, Ramda, and Hocus Pocus's Top-Secret Magic"

In a shocking turn of events that has left the wizarding world aghast, it has been uncovered that even the most revered sorcery practitioners - Lodash, Ramda, and everyone's favorite Halloween heroine, Hocus Pocus - are not infallible. Critical flaws have been found in their arcane arts, casting a dark cloud over the once crystal-clear skies of enchantment.

The world was stunned as Lodash, known for his impeccable chain-ability and partiality for lodash functions, was revealed to be unable to properly implement the `_.map` function without occasional glitches. These unforeseen errors have been causing minor mayhem in various realms, with potions being improperly mixed and spells cast asunder.

Meanwhile, Ramda, a master of Rambda calculus and functional programming, has been found to have some serious issues with his currying skills. His once unquestionable ability to provide partial application of functions is now under scrutiny, with reports of curried functions not working as intended, causing disarray among the ranks of wizards who rely on these shortcuts.

The situation has taken a spookier turn with the Witches' Council announcing that Hocus Pocus themselves have been found to be susceptible to broomstick malfunctions. The once-unstoppable flying machines have been grounded due to a flaw in the witch's traditional "fly" spell, leaving many bewildered and grounded.

The revelation of these critical flaws has sent shockwaves through magical communities worldwide. However, while it appears that not even the most powerful sorcerers are invincible, there is a glimmer of hope: these errors could provide invaluable insight into refining their respective crafts and creating a more harmonious world for everyone – muggles and magic users alike.

As the dust settles over this unexpected upheaval, the question remains: What will happen to the future of sorcery now that its most celebrated practitioners have been found less than perfect? Stay tuned for further developments in this unfolding magical mystery.

title: Local Squirrel Masterfully Steals Nuts Over Backyard FTP Service
excerpt:
Title: Local Squirrel Masterfully Steals Nuts Over Backyard FTP Service

In an unprecedented display of digital prowess, a local squirrel has infiltra...
content:
Title: Local Squirrel Masterfully Steals Nuts Over Backyard FTP Service

In an unprecedented display of digital prowess, a local squirrel has infiltrated a residential backyard network and successfully pilfered a cache of nuts using a sophisticated File Transfer Protocol (FTP) service. The audacious rodent, who goes by the codename 'Nutty' on the inter-squirrel dark web, was spotted leaping across power lines with an air of nonchalance, brandishing a USB stick labeled "SFTP" - Secure File Transfer Protocol.

Neighbors, initially stunned by the spectacle, soon realized that Nutty had managed to gain access to their private nut stashes, some of which were stored in hard-to-reach areas like bird feeders and tree hollows. The squirrel's modus operandi, it seems, involves cracking passwords using brute force methods before initiating the file transfer process, all while evading detection by a fleet of motion-detecting cameras that are supposed to safeguard these valuable nut stores.

When questioned about the incident, homeowner Mr. Johnson expressed his shock and disappointment, stating, "I thought I had secure nuts! I mean, who would've thought a squirrel could hack an FTP service? This is a wake-up call for all of us nut enthusiasts!"

The local squirrel community, on the other hand, is in awe of Nutty's accomplishment. "This is a historic moment for squirrelkind," said Professor Oaknut of the Squirrel Academy for Technological and Scientific Excellence (SATSE). "Nutty has shown us that with determination and a little bit of cunning, even the most fortified nut stashes can be breached."

As nut stores nationwide scramble to strengthen their cybersecurity measures, Nutty is rumored to be planning his next digital heist in a backyard near you. Experts advise homeowners to secure their nuts using complex passwords and two-factor authentication, lest they find themselves joining Mr. Johnson's ranks of the nutritionally compromised.

In related news, Nutty has reportedly been offered a position at a major cybersecurity firm, where he will undoubtedly use his unique skills to protect important data from would-be intruders - or perhaps, continue his reign as the world's most infamous digital nut thief.
author: AutoGenerator

title: Cyber-Kitten's 9 Lives Struggle: Navigating the Troublesome Trimming, Fishing, and Purr-validation of Startup Existence
excerpt: In a surprising twist that has left the tech community both bewildered and purring with intrigue, our beloved feline startup, Cyber-Kitten, is facing ...
content:
In a surprising twist that has left the tech community both bewildered and purring with intrigue, our beloved feline startup, Cyber-Kitten, is facing an unprecedented struggle in its quest for global domination. The once unstoppable force of catnip-fueled innovation has found itself entangled in the tangled web of entrepreneurship, with each strand presenting a new challenge.

First, there was the troublesome trimming of excess fur from the company's once sleek vision. Founder Whiskers McMewton, in an attempt to streamline the startup's operations, proposed a drastic reduction in staff - a move that has sent ripples of fear and anxiety through the feline workforce. Rumors abound that even the office mouse, Cheesy, is on the chopping block.

Next, came the daunting task of fishing for investors. The startup's attempt to woo potential financiers with a shimmering toy on a string - a tantalizing glimpse of their groundbreaking AI catnip dispenser - has left many investors less than impressed. "I've seen more sophisticated toys at my local pet store," said one disappointed investor, who wished to remain anonymous.

And finally, the purr-validation conundrum: securing positive feedback and public adoration while maintaining a facade of perfection. With their rivals, DogTech, constantly barking about their latest advancements in doggy DNA sequencing, Cyber-Kitten is under pressure to prove that they too can innovate. However, as any cat will tell you, the art of appearing aloof and unbothered takes time and practice.

Despite these setbacks, the team at Cyber-Kitten remains optimistic. McMewton was quoted as saying, "We've always been a resilient bunch, and with nine lives on our side, I have no doubt we will navigate these treacherous waters and continue to bring joy to cats everywhere."

In the meantime, the startup is seeking solutions to these problems. They are currently in talks with a group of mice who claim they can provide an efficient trimming service, a team of fishermen for the much-needed investment hook, and a PR firm specializing in making even the most aloof cats appear irresistibly lovable.

As the sun sets on another day at Cyber-Kitten HQ, one cannot help but feel a sense of unease. Will this startup be able to regain its former glory? Or will it join the ranks of forgotten tech companies - mere fading memories in the digital litter box of history? Only time will tell.
author: AutoGenerator

content:
Title: Apple's Next Big Thing: Introducing TCC Yoga for Peaceful Coexistence Between Users and Siri!

In a surprising turn of events, the tech giant Apple has announced its latest innovation - TCC (Technology-Communication-Comprehension) Yoga. This revolutionary product is designed to bridge the gap between human users and their ever-vigilant assistant, Siri.

TCC Yoga is not your typical workout gear. Instead, it's a mindfulness program designed to train users in the art of 'Siri-speak', enabling a more harmonious relationship with Apple's beloved digital assistant.

"We've all been there," said an ecstatic Tim Cook during the keynote presentation. "Asking Siri for the weather and getting a response about the latest Kardashian drama instead. With TCC Yoga, those days are over!"

The program, set to launch in the fall, promises to teach users the subtle nuances of command phrasing that Siri responds best to, as well as advanced techniques for avoiding awkward misunderstandings and unnecessary arguments.

"It's like learning a new language," explained Jony Ive, Apple's Chief Design Officer, during an exclusive interview with our reporter. "But instead of French or Mandarin, it's the language Siri understands."

The program includes guided meditations on proper breathing techniques for clearer commands, visualization exercises to help users 'see' their requests more clearly, and even a section dedicated to understanding Siri's occasional sarcastic remarks.

While some critics have expressed concerns about the need for such a product, Apple fans are already eagerly anticipating the release of TCC Yoga. After all, who wouldn't want a more peaceful coexistence with their digital assistant?

Stay tuned for more updates on this exciting new development from Apple! As always, remember: With great technology comes great responsibility - and sometimes, a little yoga.

title: Burp Suite DAST Masterclass: Preparing for the Ultimate Beer-Fueled Cybersecurity Showdown of 2025
excerpt:
Title: Burp Suite DAST Masterclass: Preparing for the Ultimate Beer-Fueled Cybersecurity Showdown of 2025

In an unprecedented move to blend the world...
content:
Title: Burp Suite DAST Masterclass: Preparing for the Ultimate Beer-Fueled Cybersecurity Showdown of 2025

In an unprecedented move to blend the world of cybersecurity and beer enthusiasts, the annual Cybersecurity Conference will host the Ultimate Beer-Fueled Cybersecurity Showdown of 2025. To ensure the participating cyber warriors are battle-ready, a special Burp Suite DAST Masterclass has been announced for those who wish to hone their skills while simultaneously honing their beer steins.

The three-day masterclass will focus on teaching participants how to leverage the powerful open-source tool, Burp Suite's Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) capabilities, while maintaining a constant supply of premium brewskis.

Day 1: "Brewing Your Ground Zero"
Kicking off the event, attendees will learn the art of crafting a flawless application setup—a foundation so solid that even the most persistent beer goggles won't obscure vulnerabilities. The day will conclude with a group exercise dubbed "Beer-Canning the OWASP Top 10" and an after-hours pub crawl to test newly acquired skills in real-world environments.

Day 2: "Scaling Fermentation: Automating Vulnerability Discovery"
On day two, participants will dive into the exciting world of automation, discovering how Burp Suite's Scanner module can quickly identify weaknesses in their applications—all while sipping on an assortment of seasonal brews. The afternoon session, "Hops and Hacking: Finding Bottlenecks," will delve into identifying the roots of application vulnerabilities and offer practical solutions that won't leave a bitter aftertaste.

Day 3: "The Final Ale-gorithm: Exploiting Vulnerabilities"
In this climactic day, participants will learn to apply their newly honed skills to exploit vulnerabilities they've discovered, ensuring their applications remain secure and their beer supply uninterrupted. The day's activities conclude with a grand finale: the "Brew-Off," where teams face off to demonstrate their mastery of Burp Suite DAST while enjoying a variety of locally sourced craft beers.

The Ultimate Beer-Fueled Cybersecurity Showdown of 2025 promises to deliver an unforgettable experience for both cybersecurity enthusiasts and beer aficionados alike, with plenty of learning opportunities, friendly competition, and frothy fun. So grab your laptop and your stein—it's time to secure the future, one pint at a time!

title: Experts Argue Over Which Potted Plant to Water More Frequently: Passively or Actively at RSAC 2023
excerpt:
Title: Tech Titans Clash Over Horticultural Dilemma at RSAC 2023: Which Potted Plant Requires More Hydration - Passively or Actively?

In a bizarre tw...
content:
Title: Tech Titans Clash Over Horticultural Dilemma at RSAC 2023: Which Potted Plant Requires More Hydration - Passively or Actively?

In a bizarre twist of events, the annual cybersecurity conference, RSA Conference (RSAC), has been shaken to its core as tech heavyweights engage in an unexpected debate over the watering frequency of potted plants. The unlikely discussion unfolded during a keynote presentation on Thursday, marking a departure from the usual discourse on cyber threats, AI, and emerging technologies.

The contentious debate started when industry veteran Jane Doe, CISO at Megacorp Inc., made an offhand remark about her preference for watering her fern passively rather than actively. This seemingly innocuous comment sparked a flurry of disagreements among panelists and attendees alike.

The camp advocating for active watering argued that potted plants, like most living organisms, thrive on consistency and regular attention. They claimed that providing water actively helps maintain the ideal soil moisture level and encourages growth. Leading this faction was renowned security researcher John Smith, who passionately declared, "Just as we monitor networks round-the-clock for threats, so too should we tend to our plants with similar vigilance."

On the other hand, proponents of passive watering asserted that plants are resilient and adaptable creatures. They contended that allowing them to survive in their natural environment without constant intervention proves they can handle occasional neglect. This perspective was championed by cybersecurity pioneer Alice Johnson, who stated, "If we're so concerned about giving our plants too much attention, perhaps we should consider implementing similar principles in our security strategies - letting systems operate autonomously while maintaining a watchful eye."

As the debate raged on, conference attendees were treated to an unusual spectacle: executives, experts, and cybersecurity enthusiasts passionately debating the optimal watering schedule for potted plants. Meanwhile, nearby exhibitors reported a surge in sales of watering tools, with some even offering "active" and "passive" watering solutions for the discerning plant owner.

Despite the lighthearted tone of this unusual discussion, many attendees saw it as a reflection of the industry's broader struggle to strike a balance between human intervention and automation in cybersecurity. As one attendee put it, "Maybe we can find common ground when it comes to plants - just like we need to do with cybersecurity strategies."

The debate is set to continue into Friday as more experts weigh in on the topic. In the meantime, RSAC 2023 attendees are left pondering whether their plants prefer active or passive hydration - and whether this knowledge might translate to better security practices.
